sentences.sentence: The governor of Lviv, a city in western Ukraine, has said 35 people are now confirmed dead after a missile attack on an international peacekeeping and security centre base on Sunday morning.

That's why we keep asking NATO to close the sky, because we can't fight an enemy who doesn't even enter Ukraine but launches a cruise missile, so it's necessary to have a serious air defense system.

sentences.sentence: In a tweet from Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky, he said that he had held talks with the Polish President Andrei Duda and the Bulgarian Prime Minister Kirill Petkov, in which he updated them on Ukraine's defence and the crimes of the Russian aggressors.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: As Russian forces continue to advance in Ukraine, Ruslan Matsenkov, the mayor of Ivano-Frankivsk in western Ukraine, says the Russian army launched an attack on the city's airport in the early hours of Sunday morning.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Ukraine's state emergency services says at least one person died and one more was injured as a result of the shelling of a nine-story residential building in Chernev, northeast of Kiev.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The Ukrainian military claim Russian forces are continuing to use civilian infrastructure for its military needs and are carrying out shelling on civilians in direct violation of international humanitarian law.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Day 18 of Russia's offensive in Ukraine started with more attacks here in the west of the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Explosions could be heard from central Lviv in the early hours of Sunday and a missile strike hit Yavoriv military base, an international military facility to the west of here, where NATO troops used to conduct military exercises alongside Ukrainian forces before they pulled out from Ukraine back in February. That military facility was now the grounds for Ukraine's new foreign legion, and it's unclear whether any foreigners were among the dozens killed in what is now the deadliest attack since the war started.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, the airport in the city of Ivano-Frankivsk was hit for a second time in as many days, leaving people in this part of the country wondering if this is going to be the new focus of Vladimir Putin's offensive in this country as the military campaign widens in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Hundreds of thousands of people travelled to the city or through here seeking shelter from the bombardment in the east and in the capital, Kyiv, and are now wondering whether or not they're going to lose the last safe haven they had in the country.

sentences.sentence: Annelies Borges from Lviv for Euronews.

sentences.sentence: Some refugees say their fears of contracting the virus have been replaced by the conflict.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: But despite Russian troops pressing on with their offensive, some have decided to return home.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Klara Ulganych, a Ukrainian pensioner, arrived in Hungary with the first wave of refugees, but she wants to return to the western city of Uzhhorod.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: I got a feeling. It's hard to put it into words, she says.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: I just can't say it. I was born there. That's my home.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: So far, Hungary has accepted some 235,000 refugees, while 1.5 million people have crossed the border into Poland.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Shoppers across North Africa are stocking up on flour and somalina as fears grow over rising food prices because of the war in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Morocco, Tunisia and Libya all import most of their wheat from Ukraine and Russia, with Tunisia getting around half of its soft wheat from Ukraine and Libya getting around 75%.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And while authorities in Tunisia say the country has enough wheat to last it for three months, prices are already starting to rise.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: According to this bakery owner, this area used to be filled with bags of flour.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: But now, he has to rely on flour meant for the Middle Eastern pastry baklava.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: I buy a 10-kilo bag for 18 dinars in stores, he added, while normally I buy the 50-kilo bags at 26 dinars at the wholesalers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And although the real effects of the Russian-Ukraine war haven't hit us, I'm worried.

sentences.sentence: How will we work?" The cost of semolina is also rising.

sentences.sentence: On Sunday, China reported nearly 3,400 new cases, doubled the amount from the previous day.
